paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant associated with familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy.

patients.phenotype: atypical type I familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy with central nervous system dysfunction

individual_records.phenotype_details: dysfunction in the central nervous system, cerebellar ataxia, and pyramidal tract signs
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Most of the family members have dysfunctions in the central nervous system, in addition to typical symptoms of type I FAP.

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to a methionine-for-valine substitution at position 30 of TTR.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with the disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with atypical symptoms not typically seen in classic type I FAP.
key_quotes: FAP-IY was found to have the mutation responsible for the methionine-for-valine substitution at position 30 of TTR.

extraction_metadata.notes: Full text provided, allowing for thorough extraction of relevant data.
